sentences: Antonio Virgilio Savona (21 December 1919 – 27 August 2009) was an Italian composer, arranger, and singer in the Italian vocal group, the Quartetto Cetra.
In 1926, aged 6, he began studying music.
Two years later, he joined a choir and at the age of 10, he debuted in a radio broadcast playing a piece on a piano during a children's program.
In 1941, he replaced Iacopo Jacomelli in a vocal quartet called Quartetto Egie.
The group changed name to Quartetto Ritmo at first, then to Quartetto Cetra one year later.
On 19 August 1944 Virgilio Savona married the singer Lucia Mannucci, who later joined Quartetto Cetra to replace Enrico De Angelis, who left the group in 1947.
On 19 August 1944 Virgilio Savona married the singer Lucia Mannucci, who later joined Quartetto Cetra to replace Enrico De Angelis, who left the group in 1947.
They collaborated for four decades and produced hundreds of songs which made up Quartetto Cetra's vast repertoire.
During the 1970s, he was active as pianist, orchestra conductor, arranger and producer.
In 1971, he wrote Angela, a song for Angela Davis, Black American communist leader, innocent in prison at this time.
In 1991, he wrote a popup book about Quartetto Cetra, published by Sperling & Kupfer in the Supersound collection.
He died in Milan in 2009 from complications of Parkinson's disease.
